words.definition: n. amixture or combination made whole
adj. made from a variety of sources; diverse in make-up
words.translation: 折衷的；选择的；折衷学派的；不拘一格的

words.definition: adj. universal, broad in tastes, interests, inclinations
adj. varied in colour, made from a variety of sources, heterogeneous
v. to bring in new evidence to support an idea or argument
n. people settled far from their homelands; the movement of people away from their homelands
v. to cut/divide into parts or groups; to adhere loyally or closely to something
words.translation: 裂开；披荆斩棘地前进；粘住；坚持；砍开；使分开；打通

words.definition: v. to scatter widely; share amongst people
v. to think deeply; lose oneself in thought
v. to be unfocused or confused
n. a physical, emotional, or spiritual journey of significant undertaking
words.translation: 漫长而惊险的旅程；成长过程，探索过程；

words.definition: n. exact opposite
words.translation: 对立面，形成对照的事物；（二者间的）对比，对照；对仗

words.definition: n. feeling of extreme dislike
n. shunning/avoiding contact with others
words.translation: 违背社会公德的人；反社会者

words.definition: v. to expect, think, or act in advance of something happening
words.translation: 预期，预料；预见（并做准备）；期望，盼望；先于……做，早于……行动；提前使用；在期限内履行（义务），偿还（债务）

words.definition: n. a medicine to counteract the effect of poison or illness
words.translation: 解毒药，解毒剂；矫正方法，对策

words.word: to bite off more than you can chew
words.definition: Idiom. to take on more than you can manage
adj. extremely generous and forgiving; courageously noble in mind & heart
words.translation: 宽宏大量的；有雅量的；宽大的

words.definition: adj. to squander, to waste; lavishly abundant
adj. to be economical or cheap (stingy) with resources
words.translation: 节俭的，节约的；（饮食）简单的，省钱的

words.definition: adj. generous in giving
adj. allowing excessive leniency, generosity, or consideration; enjoyed as a pleasure
words.translation: 纵容的，放纵的；宽容的，过于宽厚的；作为一种享受的

words.definition: adj. disinclined to engage in conversation; deliberately silent
words.translation: 沉默寡言的；无言的，不太说话的

words.definition: adj. concise, brief
adj. using few words (often roughly); to the point
adj. overly talkative; using many words without much use
words.translation: 唠叨的；喋喋不休的；多嘴的

words.definition: adj. ease of speaking but without thought, carelessly talk
words.translation: 口齿伶俐的，油嘴滑舌的

words.definition: v. to break down, to take apart
v. to remove from a position, title, etc.
v. to take away a franchise, legal right, or some privilege
v. to set or force apart
v. to understand or point out the difference between something
words.translation: 使有别于；看清，认出；区别，分清

words.definition: Idiom. to leave something alone that might cause trouble
adj. people or things that are native to a region
adj. coming from outside or elsewhere, usually irrelevant or unimportant
words.translation: 外来的；没有关联的；来自体外的

words.definition: adj. naturally or essentially part of character or thing: intrinsic
words.translation: 内在的，固有的；<法律>（权利，特权）固定属于（某人）的；

words.definition: adj. native or common to a specific region or situation
adj. innate characteristics or abilities of a being or thing
v. to expell or send away a person from a community, figuratively or literally
adj. not connected, off track
adj. foreshadowing a threat or danger in the future
adj. unfavourable, of bad luck
adj. about to occur
n. the nearing arrival of something
n. a sign of an impending occurence, almost always negative
same as "bode"
v. to appease or calm in order to create a favourable result
n. a warning or sign of what is to come, usually negative
v. cause to be a slave
words.translation: 束缚；征服；使某人成为奴隶

words.definition: v. to make incredibly angry
v. to persist through
words.translation: 持续存在，持久；忍受，忍耐

words.definition: v. to make more beautiful, to increase the attractiveness
n. a visbile representation of a characteristic, concept, idea
Idiom. to survive and persevere through a difficult situation, resulting in success
v.  to waste time, money, etc.; to use something frivalously
words.translation: 浪费，挥霍（金钱、时间等）；失去（机会）；（使）分散

words.definition: v. to lose the right to vote, or to some other right
v.  to give up something (often as a penalty or requirement)
words.translation: 丧失，被没收；（尤指为获得他物）主动放弃

words.definition: v. to formally give something up, e.g as title
words.translation: 声明放弃，抛弃；放弃（权利或地位）；拒绝承认，拒绝遵守；宣布与……断绝关系，宣布摒弃

words.definition: v. to take away something of value or necessity; to deprive of something
n. someone of extreme greed; consuming too much
words.translation: 暴食，暴饮暴食；贪食，贪吃

words.definition: adj.  excessively hungry (literal and figurative); to devour
words.translation: 贪婪的；贪吃的；狼吞虎咽的

words.definition: adj. sufficiently flavoured; acceptable/agreeable
adj. juicy (figurative or literal, e.g. gossip and meat)
words.translation: 多汁的；多水分的；多汁性的

words.definition: v. to formally discard or relinquish; to step down/resign from an official position
words.translation: 退位；放弃（责任），失（职）；放弃

words.definition: adv. Without any doubt; completely, totally
words.translation: 绝对地，完全地；确实地，极其；（强调同意或允许）当然，对极了；专制地，独裁地

words.definition: v.  to terminate or cancel something
words.translation: （使）流产，堕（胎）；（由于问题或故障）中止，使夭折；（胚胎器官，有机体）发育不全，败育

words.definition: adj.  causing damage or removal by repetitive grinding or rubbing
words.translation: 粗糙的；有研磨作用的；伤人感情的；（声音）刺耳的，难听的

words.definition: v.  to remove blame; to set someone free of obligation or consequence
Idiom. to do something improperly to save time or money; take a shortcut
adj. fortunate; of successful or favourable outcome
words.translation: 有助于成功的，有利的；吉利的，吉兆的

words.definition: adj. acting againt; opposed to
words.translation: 不利的，有害的；相反的；敌对的

words.definition: adj. harmful to
n. a poor or harmful imitation of something
words.translation: 歪曲；滑稽作品；拙劣的模仿作品

words.definition: n. a sudden, disastrous defeat or mess
n. a complete mess or failure, often due to incompetence
v.&n. overwhelmingly defeat
words.translation: 溃败；溃退；彻底击败，打垮

words.definition: n. large size or immensity (physical and figurative)
words.translation: （处境、问题、事件等的）艰巨性，严重性；庞大，巨大；暴行，滔天罪行；凶暴，穷凶极恶；重要性

words.definition: adj. determined, stubbornly persevering
adj. the stubborn expression of unproven/unprovable opinions
n. thankfullness; the state of being grateful/thankful
n. vertical distance or height; a high level (quality or feeling)
words.translation: 海拔高度；高地；（天体在地平线上的）地平纬度；顶垂线；（等级和地位等的）高级

words.definition: n. insipid; a remark so overused it lacks interest or thought
n. a natural ability to do something
words.translation: 天资，天赋；自然的倾向，习性；适宜

words.definition: n. a lack of skill or ability
words.translation: 不适当，不合适；不称职；愚笨；缺乏技巧，无能；笨拙

words.definition: Idiom. a conflcit or problem no longer matters
words.translation: 过去的事情，既定的事实

words.definition: Idiom. criticisms or warnings that have no impact on a person
n. a poisonous atmosphere or influence
n. a magnificent and official display
adj. outstandingly bad or offensive
words.translation: 惊人的；过分的；恶名昭彰的

words.definition: adj. tiny
v. teasing and flattering verbally to get what you want
v. to seek with humility
words.translation: 恳求，哀求；乞求，急切地要求得到

words.definition: v. asking in a desperate or emotional manner
v. trying to romantically attracting another
v. ask in a sincere manner
n. someone who focuses too much on themself
n. a behaviour characteristic specific to a person or group
words.translation: （个人独有的）气质，性格，习惯，癖好

words.definition: n. someone who lives in solitude; hermit
n. rebel, outlaw
adj. characterized by widespread growth or extend
n. a realisation
words.translation: （对重要事物或宗教真谛的）顿悟

words.definition: n. the surface above the focus of and earthquake
n. one devoted to sensual experience
words.translation: 享乐主义者；美食家；信奉伊壁鸠鲁主义的人

words.definition: v. to serve as the typical or ideal example
words.translation: 成为……的典范，作为……的缩影

words.word: Give someone the benefit of the doubt
words.definition: Idiom. To believe/trust someone in spite of the circumstances
